TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , born in DATE , was a NORP national until DATE and is now stateless . He is currently living in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant went to GPE in DATE and was legally resident there . In DATE he married an NORP national with whom he has had CARDINAL children , born in DATE and DATE respectively . In DATE the applicant requested NORP citizenship .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON für PERSON ) convicted the applicant of attempting to put into circulation large amounts of narcotic drugs , as well as certain minor offences under LAW , and sentenced him to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .
On DATE the applicant renounced his NORP nationality in order to be able to obtain NORP nationality .
On DATE , ORG ) issued an unlimited residence prohibition against the applicant under LAW § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW DATE ( PERSON DATE ) .

On DATE ORG ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . Referring to the applicant ’s living with an NORP national and their having CARDINAL children , it found that the residence prohibition constituted an interference with the applicant ’s right to respect for his private and family life . However , having regard to the serious nature of the offences committed by him , it was necessary for the aims set out in LAW , namely for the prevention of crime and the protection of health and public safety .

On DATE ORG detained the applicant with a view to his expulsion . It requested the NORP embassy to issue a travel document , which was refused on the ground that the applicant had renounced his NORP nationality . He was released on DATE as his expulsion could not be carried out due to his statelessness .

On DATE ORG ( Unabhängiger Verwaltungssenat ) found , upon the applicant ’s complaint , that his above detention had been unlawful . It noted that , pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW DATE , an alien could be detained if this was necessary , inter alia , for securing his deportation . The applicant was stateless and his expulsion to GPE was , thus , impossible . ORG had been informed about the applicant ’s statelessness well before DATE . It followed that , from the outset , his detention could not possibly have served the purpose of securing his deportation .
On DATE ORG refused to deal with the applicant ’s complaint concerning the residence ban as it lacked sufficient prospects of success .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint . The decision was served on DATE .

The applicant still lives in GPE . His request for NORP citizenship remained unsuccessful and he is , according to his own submissions , still stateless . He and his wife divorced in DATE . The applicant submits that they are planning to remarry but are prevented from doing so as he has no passport . A number of requests to have the residence ban quashed under LAW DATE , which has meanwhile entered into force , were dismissed .
